node.title: Live updates: Omicron raging around the world, WHO warns against complacency
node.content: ["New Zealand continued its low run of new COVID-19 community cases with only 28 on Wednesday. ", "What is continuing to grow however are the cases of the new Omicron variant at the border. There were 64 new cases detected on Thursday, bringing the total number of Omicron cases at the border to 196.\u00a0", "There were 28 new community cases announced on Tuesday and 65 at the border.", "Thirty-one people are in hospital, including two in ICU or HDU.", "Two more people have died with COVID-19.", "Northern Bass has been cancelled due to low vaccination rates in the region.", "Click here for locations of interest.", "10:00am - Kia ora, good morning and welcome to Newshub's live updates for Wednesday.", "New Zealand may have successfully kept the Omicron variant out of the community but it is raging elsewhere.", "Omicron is on track to infect more than half of Europeans, but it should not yet be seen as a flu-like endemic illness, the World Health Organization (WHO) said recently.", "Europe saw more than 7 million newly-reported cases in the first week of 2022, more than doubling over a two-week period, WHO's Europe director Hans Kluge told a news briefing.", "\"At this rate, the Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation forecasts that more than 50 percent of the population in the region will be infected with Omicron in the next 6-8 weeks,\" Kluge said, referring to a research centre at the University of Washington.", "Fifty out of 53 countries in Europe and central Asia have logged cases of the more infectious variant, Kluge said.", "Evidence, however, is emerging that Omicron is affecting the upper respiratory tract more than the lungs, causing milder symptoms than previous variants. But the WHO has cautioned more studies are still needed to prove this.", "\u00a0"]
